title: Danny’s a weird name for an alien
archive_warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
additional_tags: or at least the League thinks he’s an alien
Danny Fenton is a Little Shit
no beta we die like danny
summary:
Danny, racing to get out of a bad situation didn’t notice when his parents Specter Speeder was malfunctioning and too tired and injured to do anything about it ends up in a new world with heroes and aliens.

Except these heroes think he’s an alien.

Danny adjusts to life with heroes

Danny has some big decisions to make

text:
Danny was injured and he needs to leave 

now. 

He just needs to make it to his parents’ lab and get to the portal then he’ll be free. He’s going to be honest he and his friends and sister knew something like this could happen. Being hunted down even if he was still Danny Fenton and not just Phantom. They needed a plan other than fuck around and find out.


So here he is getting into the Specter Speeder about to be launched into the depths of the Ghost Zone to escape possible vivisection. He was too weak to travel through the Zone by himself so he’ll need to take it. Rushing and trying to keep his ghost form from bleeding out he doesn’t notice how the controls flicker. All he knows is he needs to leave.


With the Speeder ready to go he leans back in the pilot seat ￼and gets ready to heal slower than usual. Before he knows it he’s off into the portal and the swirling of green around him and the humming of the technology surrounding him lulls him to sleep.


He’s not conscious enough to realize something is wrong. ￼


——


When the watch tower gets an alert that there was an energy spike close to earth and a green portal opened up only to shoot out a pod-looking space ship everyone is vigilant. Batman was able to trace it to tell that it was going to land in a desert in the middle of nowhere. Well more like crash considering it was spinning out of control and was only picking up speed and not slowing down.


With Superman, Green Lantern, and Batman choosing to deal with this they were quickly off to the landing sight. It was nothing too impressive but there was a small crater where the pod landed. Nothing emerged from it as they got closer it was almost like there was nothing inside at all. It wasn’t until Superman heard a faint buzzing sound that seemed to mimic a heartbeat and breathing he could barely even detect due to it being too slow and shallow that a cause of urgency kicked in. Not waiting any more time the lid to the pod was ripped off of its hinges and inside lay a boy.


A young boy who seemed to be in his early teens was asleep in the pilot seat and he seemed gravely injured. None of the men there could dismiss the fact that the child was also very much not human. He had Snow White hair and his skin had a slight blue tint to it that made it look less than normal. He also wore something that could resemble a space suit or a hazmat suit. On his chest was a stylized D or P maybe a combination of both. None of them knew what it meant but for all they knew of this strange new boy it could be a family crest like Superman’s S.


They quickly returned to the watch tower where the boy could get medical attention. He was injured in a number of places that would be very concerning but they were healing quickly. This didn’t stop the med bay doctors from stitching up what they could although they had to do it twice when they noticed that the stitches were melting. They used the same material they used on Meta’s with deterioration powers.


As the boy slept the Justice League held a meeting to discuss what to do with the boy.


“He’s obviously an alien which means he falls under my jurisdiction. Let me deal with him and find out where he’s from.” Green Lantern laid out his argument.


“He is an unknown. We don’t know what his arrival could mean.” Batman was cautious of the new arrival.


“He is a child! He might be an alien but he is obviously a child.” Superman felt a sort of kinship with the young alien. He reminded him of himself. Sent to a new world, he’ll probably be confused when he wakes.


Eventually, they are able to come to an agreement. Wait for the child to wake, get any information they could, and decide how to proceed when they are better informed.


——


It took a full 48 hours for Danny to wake up although he didn’t know the full time. All he knew was he went to sleep in the speeder and woke up to a pace vaguely resembling a hospital. Freaking out because a hospital is the last place he expected to end up, especially such a human-looking one. He would have been calmer if it was at least the Far Frozen hospital.


He was not hooked up to anything but he could feel the stitches that are in his skin. He noticed how he was completely healed and yet there were stitches in places he remembered being more injured. Going intangible in the places they were placed he quickly got rid of them.


Feeling uneasy in this new place Danny was quick to make an escape. When he couldn’t open the door he went through it and ran down the maze of halls. He kept running until he came across a man walking down the halls in the opposite way he was coming. He wore a red suit that reminded Danny of his own hazmat suit.


The man spotted him as Danny ran past him yelling, “Hey kid! Wait!” But Danny paid no mind to it until he noticed the man suddenly appeared in front of him in a red blur. Danny screeched to a halt for long enough for the man to say, “You don’t need to run it-” he didn’t stick around long enough to hear what the man had to say.


Floating off the ground there was enough room for Danny to fly straight over the man. He continued to fly close to the ceiling and phased through walls and doors when necessary. He didn’t come to a halt until he got to what looked like a meeting room with a few other people. He paid the people no mind because all he could focus on was the stars threw the window.


Right out on the other side of a window was a galaxy Danny thought he was never going to be able to see. He’s been to space before but that was in dire situations and he wasn’t able to take anything in. Now even through his panic, he couldn’t help the awe and amazement from appearing on his face. Very slowly he floated closer to the glass until he could rest his hand on it. He stared out into the deep void until he felt a hand on his shoulder.


——


A few of the Justices League members were in a meeting about the boy who hasn’t woken up yet when said boy comes flying through the door. Quite literally flying through the door. The boy seemed to be perfectly fine. The previous day they discovered that the suit he wore repaired itself as he healed. It was perfectly intact with no tears or rips￼ to be seen.


The boy was floating a few feet above the ground and the blatant display of power surprised a few Leaguers. This also showed Batman what the alien’s life or planet was like. No hesitation to use powers and they came naturally to him. This isn’t a Superman situation where the sun gave him his powers but maybe more of a Martian where they have powers due to their biology.


The boy looked to be panicking, most likely from waking up in an unknown space. But his face quickly changed to amazement when his bright green eyes landed on the window. He seemed to zero in on it and slowly floated to it until he was close enough to touch it.


They just stared at the kid for a bit until Superman floated over to him and put a hand on his shoulder. This seemed to get his attention as he tensed under the hand. He looked up at Superman and the man tried to send him a comforting smile.


“There’s no need to panic, we are here to help,” Superman said in a soft voice. One he used in scared civilians.


“Who are you?” The boy questioned. The League members were both surprised and great full that the alien child knew English, it would make communicating much easier.


“I go by Superman, but my name is Kal-El. My friends and I just want to help you and maybe get you home.” The boy tensed further at the mention of home.


“There is no home to go back to.” He looked down at his feet and seemed to notice for the first time that they were not touching the ground, and neither was Superman’s.


He softly landed on the ground and looked back up at Clark with surprise written all over his face. He looked over at the other heroes in the room, truly seeing them for the first time. Both Batman and Manhunter took notice of how his eyes lingered on J’onn the most.


It was quiet for a moment, the adults letting the boy take everything in. Wonder Woman was the one to break the peace. “May we ask for your name, young one?” His attention snapped to the one who addressed him and hesitantly he said, “My name is Phantom, Danny Phantom.”


——


As Danny looked around the room he came to the conclusion he was nowhere close to home. He thinks he would remember if there were people like this. He stared at a man who has green skin for a moment longer than the rest. He would have thought he was a ghost if it weren’t for his ghost senses not going off.


He was introduced to the rest of the adults after telling them his name. They informed him of what they were and how they were heroes and that just solidified Danny's thoughts of not being home or even in the same world. It wasn’t too crazy to think that he ended up in a different world, a different dimension when the Ghost Zones alternative name is the Infinite Realms.


These people also seem to think he is an alien like a few of them. Considering the fact they saw him appear in the Specter Speeder and he is literally from a different world wasn’t a far-off guess. He called his plant Amity and let them believe he was what they think he is.


They asked a lot of questions, some Danny answered as best as possible and others he bullshitted his way through. They came to the conclusion his planet no longer exists and he is the last of his kind. Danny wasn’t about to correct them, who knew what they would think of a half-ghost.


He learned that the one he thought was a ghost’s name was J’onn J’onzz and he was a Martian from Mars. This immediately caught Danny’s attention as he asked a million questions about Mars.


——


The boy, Danny as they now knew, seemed to take a liking to J’onn the most. They can see why with his bluish skin and similar power set. He seemed to want to know everything and anything about Mars and Martians. J’onn was happy to indulge the boy and answer as many questions as possible.


The questions eventually leaned to powers and how similar some of their powers were. J’onn showed Danny how he can shift his form to look like others and even showed him his human secret identity form. Danny taking a chance said, “I can do something like that too! Hey Batman?” He turned to the dark knight and he got a grunt in response. “Can I see what human teenagers look like?” A little surprised and confused by this question but not seeing the harm in it Bruce pulled up pictures of random teens on his wrist￼ computer, showing it to Danny. The kid smiled and said thanks and a ring of light appeared around him.


Batman, the closest, closed his eyes at the bright light and when he opened them again a very human boy with slightly softer features and different clothing appeared in Danny’s place.


“How do I look? Human enough?” He turned in a circle like he was showing off a new outfit.


——


Danny can see the surprise on some of the League’s faces at his sudden shift. He thought it was quite smart of himself to label his halfa status as simply being able to change his form. He was getting more confident in being here the more he learned.

 

Danny has been in this new world for a few days. It’s exactly like his and yet so different. They have mostly the same media and celebrities and even history but then this world has superheroes and villains. He’s been staying in the watchtower in what seemed to be a spare room. They don’t know what to do with him yet but they aren’t suspicious.

 

Whenever questioned about his home planet he just talks about the Infinite Realms. He was asked what it looked like and Danny said mainly green with floating islands. When questioned how he can speak English he said he can speak a lot of different languages from all over. It helps that that wasn’t a lie, he really can speak all kinds of languages. Some he didn’t even know existed like Superman’s mother language. 

 

It comes in handy when you have the knowledge of the Realms to fall back into. It makes Danny seem otherworldly in a way he was all too used to back home. Here it was a new type of normal. It made him feel normal and less like the freak he was known as back home. 

 

When questioned about his abilities Danny answered as truthfully as possible. He told them that he was more powerful than average but everyone back home had some type of invisibility, intangibility, and flying. His powers didn’t stem from the sun or something else unique from earth but just his biology. 

 

This of course led to him having to demonstrate a majority of his powers.

 

They took him to a training room out of the watchtower and down on earth. Danny was nervous at first when Batman said they were going to run some tests, thinking back to the reason he left his home in the first place. But likely seeing the nerves on his face and in the way he held himself Black Canary was quick to reassure him it would be more like a show and tell. 

 

Back in his ghost form, and wasn’t that fun to explain he can change forms at will, Danny stood in the middle of a training mat not really knowing what to do first. Black Canary and Batman were the only people observing him and they weren’t even in the same room. There was a glass window separating Danny from the adults due to his own request. He didn’t want them getting in the way of energy blasts or ice. 

 

“Just start with whatever’s easiest and work your way up from there.” Black Canary’s voice came through the intercom speaker. Danny just gave her a thumbs-up and started flying in place. This was definitely the easiest thing to do. Losing the hold gravity has on him was like taking off an extra layer in the sun. It felt better to float and fly in his ghost form than it did to have his feet on the ground. 

 

Staying visible he went back down to the ground but let intangibility take over his legs so he slipped right into the earth. He came back up and went invisible. These were all powers the League knew well due to their extended use. 

 

Danny set off a few ecto blasts towards the far wall leaving burn marks. He let out both more chaotic blasts that were big and powerful and hard to control and more concentrated blasts that left small marks. This was to show his control and he did the same with his ice. He let the temperature drop to freezing levels watching as the window iced over. 

 

Floating down to the ground he changed back to his human form to signal that he was done. Danny might trust these people but he’s not stupid enough to show them everything he can do. He doesn’t even remember his entire power set off the top of his head. The basics should be enough to satisfy them. Walking towards the window he turned intangible going through the wall. 

 

“Well, that’s it!” 

 

“That’s quite the power range.”

 

“Yeah but only the ice is really uniquely mine.”

 

The small group headed back for the watchtower to properly debrief and talk about Danny’s powers. Although Danny did stop by his room to grab a model spaceship he was given. It was one that you had to put together yourself. 

 

The group of three went to the meeting room where there were a few hero’s lounging around talking to one another. The meeting room was used as a sort of common room when there were no pressing matters to attend to. Danny changed back into Phantom as they situated themselves.

 

“As you’ve said before, the people of your home planet all have invisibility, intangibility, and flying. Are you sure you don’t remember which sector your planet is from?”

 

“I don’t know much about other planets. It wasn’t a part of my education back home.” Danny was in the air with his legs crossed like he was sitting in a chair. He was fiddling with a model spaceship with pieces and tools floating around him, coming closer when he needed them. 

 

“What was schooling like back home?” He doesn’t know who asked because he was too focused on his project. Maybe it was rude to be working on this when people were trying to talk to him but he couldn’t help it. Superman gave it to him earlier that morning and he was excited to display it in his room. 

 

“It was pretty average for the most part.” Danny thought back on the American public education system, “maybe a bit below average for my town. But when I was named prince I was put through more advanced lessons that weren’t all that traditional.” He said, not really paying attention to what was coming out of his mouth. 

 

It was silent for a bit and Danny wondered why before realizing what he said. 

 

“You’re royalty?” 

 

Danny sheepishly rubbed the back of his neck and felt his face grow hot. “Yeah… I was named the crown prince a little while ago. I was supposed to be crowned king when I was of age.” He noticed he got the attention of everyone in the room, which wasn’t a lot but it was enough for his cheeks to glow green under the attention. 

 

Batman seemed to narrow his eyes at him but Danny could never really tell with him. “And why didn’t you share this information before?” Danny shrugged and tried to go back to his project, screwing some pieces in place. “It just didn’t seem all that important. It’s not like I’m royalty here so why would it matter?” 

 

“You said you would have been crowned king when you came of age, did something happen to the current king?” Wonder Woman chimed in as she walked over to sit closer to Danny. Danny chewed on his cheek wondering how much he should say. 

 

“There is no current king. I defeated him in single combat so I took the throne. The only reason I didn’t take the crown as well is that I was too young.” 

 

“The title of king doesn’t go down to the next of kin in the royal family?”

 

Danny shrugged again. He knew the way the Ghost Zone didn’t work normally, none of it did, but he didn’t need these adults judging it. “The King is the most powerful person; it has nothing to do with blood ties. I didn’t even want the crown. The only reason I took the title is that the last king was a tyrant who needed to be stopped.” 

 

Superman had a look of concern and maybe even pity on his face, “But you are a child. Why couldn’t an adult take the challenge?” 

 

“I asked myself that a lot too… Can we talk about something else?” Batman seemed like he wanted to press further but Canary stepped in.

 

“You’ve shown how you can speak many different languages, some you didn’t even know of, what’s your home planet’s language?” 

 

Danny set down his project, letting it fall softly to the table so that he can finally give the heroes his full attention. “I don’t know how you will be able to take it.” He knew mortals couldn’t understand or even really comprehend Ghost Speak. “You need very specific vocal cords.” More like no vocal cords at all. “B̵̗̖̺̾̀̚ǘ̴͇ṫ̴͔̥͊̍ ̷̛̳̪͈̎̆h̸̬̀o̶͖̓͛̏w̷̯͍̝͐̑̚ ̶̥̅̋ḑ̷́́͘o̵͓̹̪̾͒e̶̝̜͗̓͒s̵̜̥̟͐͋ ̴̘͛t̴͓͔̍̀h̵̲̒̈́͐ī̸̮s̸̱̤̉̾͝ ̶͔̠̀̑̎s̵͉̀͜o̴̢͆̐u̷̧͔̎̉̃n̴̳͍̬̈d̵̘̋̾͒?” He let the noise come out of his mouth. To him, it was just a different language, no stranger than any other. But to the heroes, it was like static to a radio and nails on a chalkboard and many voices overlapping each other in different pitches. The words were echoing inside their skulls. The heroes with super hearing covered their ears with their hands but it did nothing to help. 

 

“Yeah, I don’t think I should speak like that again,” Danny said in regular English. Batman was of course the quickest to recover. “Maybe not…” He agreed ominously. 

 

“Next on the agenda, I would like to discuss a more permanent living situation for you.” 

 

“I thought I was good to stay at the watchtower?” Were they kicking him out? 

 

“I, along with some other members, have decided that it would be more beneficial for you to be among people your age. Going to school and being down on earth would be better than staying up here.” Danny couldn’t help but groan at the mention of school. He knew no matter what universe or dimension it was going to be hell. Black Canary started talking, gaining the boy’s attention, “We still want you to have some say and control in what happens to you so we gathered some options on who to stay with. You can decide where you would like to settle down and you will have time to think it over. This isn’t a right now decision, we will give you time to think it over.” Danny can appreciate that they want to take his thoughts into count but in the end, none of this was his say. 

 

Black Canary handed him some files from seemingly out of nowhere and with further inspection Danny saw they were on some different heroes. “These are people who are all willing to take you in.” She smiled at him, seemingly having noticed his unease. Danny hasn’t had a good experience with people wanting to adopt him in the past. Quickly skimming through the files he’s surprised to find Batman and not so surprised to find Superman. 

 

“Can I go to my room to think this over?” He asked quietly, not looking up from the papers in his hand. 

 

“Of course.”

 

With that, he got up and floated out of the room, his projects drifting behind him. He had some thinking to do and he would like to do it in the privacy of his own room. 

 

He didn’t notice Canary informing Batman, “He didn’t say he had telekinesis…” And Batman hummed in acknowledgment. 

 

Getting to his room and locking the door behind him he spread out the files along his desk. Looking around the room he notices what he will have to pack up to move in with whoever he chooses. There’s already some stuff cluttering the room. The bed sheets are a deep navy blue, they used to be plain white. There are glow-in-the-dark stars on the ceiling that Green Lantern got him within his first week when he mentioned he liked looking into space. A pre-built model car was on his nightstand that Flash got Danny when he mentioned to him that he was interested in engineering. A sword hung on his wall from when Wonder Woman thought he would appreciate it considering he said how cool her sword fighting was. Something called a Nintendo Switch was sitting on his bed from Batman. He didn’t mention anything about video games to the man and he had to learn how to use it because he had nothing like it back home. 

 

His lack of knowledge of games seemed to drive home how otherworldly he was. 

 

Looking back to the files Danny focused on the task at hand. He had a decision to make and he wasn’t going to half-ass this one. 

 

It seemed important. 

 

Danny was face down on his bed trying not to scream. 

 

The people who wanted him (and isn’t that crazy? People, adults, actually wanted him) seemed so amazing and it was getting frustrating trying to pick. It’s been two days already going around talking to the people who submitted a file trying to get to know them better. They said he had no time limit but he can tell the Justice League was getting antsy for his answer. 

 

Danny pushed himself onto his forearms so he wasn’t actively suffocating himself with his bed and huffed out a breath. It was earlier in the morning according to his clock, not that he can tell with his window just being space. He was still in his pajamas, a simple white baggy t-shirt and black pajama pants with yellow stars. Rolling off his bed dramatically he let himself hit the ground with a loud thud. He stared at the glow-in-the-dark star stickers on his ceiling trying to will himself to get up and change into actual clothes.

 

He had someone else to meet today. 

 

One person he didn’t even know about submitted a file to adopt him. Some guy named Nightwing who’s apparently a part of Batman’s ragtag team of sad vigilantes, at least that’s what Flash said. He never even met the dude before so why the hell he wants to adopt him is lost on Danny. 

 

There was a knock on his door and he heard Superman’s voice coming through from the other side, “Danny? Are you awake kiddo? Nightwing will be here to take you to lunch in a bit.” Danny sat up and yelled back, “Yeah I’m up! Just rolling out of bed…” He added quietly even though he knew Kal-El would hear him. 

 

Finally getting up he went over to his closet that is steadily gaining more and more clothes. There was a plethora of hoodies, jeans, and plain shirts. The heroes seemed to notice his preference for non-graphic shirts unless space themed. Grabbing black jeans, a dark green shirt, and a white hoodie with the classic NASA logo that J’onn gave him yesterday Danny started getting ready. 

 

The phantom walked into the bathroom connected to his room to try to comb his hair only to give up and brush his teeth. Some of his teeth were now naturally more pointy than normal humans. It adds to the not-really-human theme he has going on. That and his pointy ears… and the fact his eyes gleam like a cat’s. Maybe it’s not really a theme but a fact. 

 

Danny can have a minor crisis over that later right now he has to meet Nightwing.

 

Walking into the eating area that’s used more of a lounge area Danny walks over to where there is a couch in the corner and dramatically flops onto it. He can hear some of the heroes in the room snicker at him but he just lays there. Sitting up he sees Flash and Green Lantern looking at him eating muffins. Flash was inhaling them more than anything. 

 

“Damn are they good?” Danny asked Flash teasingly with one of his eyebrows raised. He’s learned that some heroes he can joke around like that with, Flash being one of them. The hero in red just throws a muffin at him and in a very childish motion sticks his tongue out. Danny catches it with no problem and starts eating. It’s blueberry. 

 

Halfway through someone else walks into the room. He was wearing a skin-tight black suit that had a blue bird-type logo on his chest. He also had a domino mask that whited out his eyes. He has black hair and Danny would have called him a loser for his mullet at least it wasn’t a country hick one. It took Danny longer than he was willing to admit that the guy was walking over towards him. 

 

“Hey, you’re Danny right?” The guy who Danny now assumes is Nightwing asked. “Yep.” He took another bite. “I’m Nightwing, whenever you’re ready we can head out.” He sent what would have been a charming smile if Danny couldn’t feel the nervousness coming off of this guy. “Now’s fine.” If he was put off at all by Danny’s short answer he didn’t show it. 

 

Quickly finishing his muffin the teen got up from the couch and followed close behind the man as they walked to the zeta tubes. “Where’re we going? I’ve barely been outside the watchtower.” And that’s true, Danny can count on one hand how many times he was taken down to earth in the few weeks he’s been here. Nightwing looked down at him and replied, “We’re going to Gotham. You been to Gotham?” Danny simply shakes his head no. “That’s where I live, well technically I live in Bludhaven, Gotham's sister city, but I’m pretty evenly split between the two. I know I said I was taking you out to lunch but it’s only eleven we can do something else until you’re hungry.” They stopped in front of the zeta tube as Danny thought of what to do until lunchtime. “Can we go sightseeing? I heard that the architecture of Gotham is very interesting.” He couldn’t help but be reminded of Sam and how much she would have loved it. 

 

Nightwing nodded at him, humming a bit, “Sure we can sightsee although the best view is up high.” Danny grinned something feral, for a split second he wondered if Nightwing would be freaked out by his teeth. “The higher the better.” Danny transformed into his ghost form with a bright flash. When the flash went away he saw Nightwing blink repeatedly with a somewhat shocked look on his face. “I knew you could manipulate your form but I didn’t realize the transformation was that bright.” Danny rubbed the back of his neck sheepishly, “Yeah sorry for not warning you about that.” Nightwing raised his hand slightly like he was going to touch Danny but thought better of it. “It’s fine kiddo. Let’s get out of here.” 

 

Walking into the zeta tube they arrived in some alleyway phone booth that was run down. Danny walked out first noticing how he glowed slightly in the dark alley even though it was early. Looking up he saw how cloudy it was almost like it was going to rain any minute. Nightwing seemed to notice his looks because he explained, “It won’t rain until tonight but most of the time it’s cloudy like this.” Danny just nodded instead of answering properly.

 

Nightwing pulled a grappling hook from nowhere and with no further warning he took off to the top of the nearest building. Danny was quick on his heels and flew after the man. It was fun, Danny can admit that. He didn’t know what he was expecting but it wasn’t this. Maybe some awkward small talk that most adults do when they don’t know what to say to a kid. Nightwing made it easy. Being around Nightwing was easy. 

 

They gradually got to higher and higher buildings and the buildings seemed to get older too. There were gargoyles decorating them and Danny was having fun perching on them like a bird. 

 

“Hey! How fast can you fly?” Nightwing asked as he did a truly amazing flip through the air. Danny was sure if he needed to breathe he would be out of breath if he tried that. 

 

“Uhhhh I don’t really know?” It sounded more like a question than an answer. “I never really tested it out.” 

 

They landed on the edge of a building overlooking the city. Danny sat down mid-air so he didn’t have to crane his neck to look up at Nightwing who was still standing. “Does it take up much energy to stay in the air like that?” Nightwing still had to look down a bit to look Danny in the eyes. “Not really? At least I don’t think so. It’s easy and comfortable to stay in the air, like second nature.” 

 

“How different is earth from your home planet?” Danny almost wanted to laugh at that. The Ghost Zone was completely different from earth to the point everything might as well be opposite. “Almost as different as life and death.” He chuckled a bit at his inside joke that he knew Nightwing wouldn’t understand. “The sky was green and there was no gravity.” The gravity part seemed to shock him. “How did things stay on the ground?” 

 

“Easy… there was no ground. We had floating islands that you could fly underneath and between. Everything that needed to be on the ground just was. We never worried about falling off an island because we could fly.” 

 

“How did boundaries work? Like were there countries?”

 

“There were kingdoms and sectors that had rulers or tribes. Some places belonged to no one but the high king himself.” 

 

“What’s the high king?”

 

Did no one tell him about the royalty? Danny wondered 

 

“Well, there were kingdoms that had royalty that ruled over that land, for example, my friends Dora and Frostbite! Dora is the queen of the Old Lands but only the Old Lands like how Frostbite is the leader of the Far Frozen but only the Far Frozen. The high king is the ruler of the entire planet. He helps keep order between the different sectors. He also rules over the Old Lands and Far Frozen but not as intimately as Dora or Frostbite.” 

 

Nightwing seemed content to just sit back and listen to Danny explain where he came from. “That must be a lot of responsibility and work.” He said under his breath but Danny of course heard it. “Oh it is, you won’t believe the type of training I was put through to inherit the throne.” The face Nightwing made at that information made Danny laugh and topple over mid-air as if he was rolling around on the ground. “You’re the high king? You’re like 13!” Danny gasped in mock offense. “I’m more like 15 and I was the prince, not king. I can’t exactly have a coronation if I’m not there.” Not that he wanted one. The whole being king thing wasn't something he wanted to do. 

 

Nightwing's face softened. “Is that why you’re here? Did you run away?” Danny was more timid now he looked up from under his white fringe and said, “It… it wasn’t safe… anymore. I had to get away but I didn’t mean to come here. I was tired so I couldn’t fly so I took the s-ship.” He almost messed up and said speeder. Nightwing didn’t need to lower his posture much to meet Danny at eye level. “Can you tell me why it wasn’t safe?” And damn did Danny want to. It was easy to talk to Nightwing about this stuff and he just met him. He didn’t prod like Batman about further information. He didn’t try to change the subject when things got too sad like some of the others. Danny knew that they just wanted to keep him happy but he couldn’t just keep this stuff to himself. But what did he tell the man? Oh yeah, I had to run away from a dangerous situation because I would have jumped into the grave instead of having only one foot in it. No that would reveal too much. 

 

“People wanted to hurt me. I wasn’t the most well-liked in some parts. It felt like there was no one to turn to…” He trailed off then he didn’t know what else to say. “Wasn’t there some adult you could have gone to?” Danny almost scoffed at that. “Reasonable adult? Like who? The ones who thought it was a good idea to have a 14-year-old be king? I almost was crowned at 14 but was able to talk some sense into them.” He knew he wasn’t being fair to Clockwork or Pandora or any of the other ancients that helped him but really he didn’t ask to be king. “I haven’t had the best experiences with adults so sorry for not exactly trusting them.” 

 

There was silence between the two and it hung heavily. 

 

“Wanna kidnap a gargoyle?” Danny’s head snapped up to Nightwing and let out a bark of surprised laughter. “What?” He said, still laughing. It was such an obvious change of subject but it worked with getting Danny out of his head. “Some of them are hanging on by hope alone. It's unsafe. Who would notice if one goes missing? Maybe one of the smaller ones.” Danny straightened out and landed on the edge of the building with Nightwing noticing once again how tall all these heroes are. “Sure, let's kidnap one.” His stomach gave its own answer, “But first let’s get that lunch you promised me.” 

 

Nightwing laughed and jumped off the building in response. 

 

—

 

Danny had fun with Nightwing. He took him to this fast food place that was superhero themed. No one even looked twice at them apparently Gotham citizens are immune to bullshit. 

 

He was taken back to the watchtower after lunch and Nightwing left soon after. This left Danny to entertain himself in the meantime. Staring up at his ceiling he got the idea to rearrange the stars there. Currently, they were just scattered about but he bet he could make them look like the constellation he memorized and loved so much. 

 

He started to carefully peel off the stickers and lay them out on his desk when someone knocked on the door. Danny likes that, how good the heroes were with knocking and not walking in without permission. “Come in!” Danny yelled, not really caring who was on the other side. J’onn walked in and asked what he was doing. “I’m trying to redo these to look like constellations from home.” Danny learned that being in a new dimension came with an unfamiliar solar system. They didn’t have the same constellations Danny thinks he’s going to miss them. 

 

“Would you like some help?” J’onn walked closer to the point he was under some of the stars Danny still needed to take down. “Sure! Can you start taking down the stars?” J’onn nodded and floated up toward the ceiling. They worked in silence for a while until all of the stars were down. 

 

“You can’t really help me with the constellations because you don’t know what they look like but you can hang around if you want.” Danny kinda wants him to stick around. J’onn was a peaceful person to be around and he wouldn’t mind the company. J’onn was an empath after all so maybe he knew what he wanted to ask when he stuck around. 

 

It was quiet again when Danny asked, “How was it… adjusting to earth?” He wasn’t looking at J’onn when he asked. He was mapping out Orion's Belt when the Martian answered. “Humans and Martians are very different. I had to learn what was and wasn’t socially acceptable here on earth. I made mistakes but I also made great progress. This does not mean I wiped where I came from or my past culture from myself to seem more human. You do not need to stop being you in order to adjust. I would say you’re doing great already.” And wasn’t that reassuring? Danny already had an advantage to being from earth but this world is so different from what he’s used to.

 

He’s more like an alien than he was willing to admit for a while. He wasn’t human and that was okay. He didn’t need to be human and that was something he’s been working on since he died. 

 

Danny was about to respond when he heard something going on somewhere in the watchtower. It sounded like an argument which was weird because he heard Superman’s voice. He didn’t bother floating all the way to the floor when he went to investigate. J’onn must have heard it too because he didn’t question Danny, only followed right behind him. 

 

The argument got louder until Danny followed it to the meeting room. It was probably rude to eavesdrop like this and he had no business listening to an argument but he saw multiple heroes in here not just Superman and the person he was arguing with. Speaking of that person, he was a young man with black hair and blue eyes wearing a black shirt with Superman’s S on it. Danny couldn’t help but notice how much he looked like Superman. 

 

Must be family drama Danny thought as he floated through the doorway. No one seemed to notice his arrival. 

 

“No, you don’t get to do this!” 

 

“I’m just saying-”

 

“No, you’re not listening to me!”

 

“You’re acting like-”

 

“Don’t you dare call me a child I swear to…” Danny didn’t know what they were arguing about but the younger of the two kept cutting off Superman until he seemed to trail off when he caught Danny’s eye. “Who’s this?” He asked. Danny just floated there awkwardly fidgeting with his hands. Wonder Woman stepped forward signaling for Danny to walk towards her. When she got close enough she put a hand on his shoulder. “This is Danny Phantom, he’s been staying here for a while.” Danny waved his hand and the guy kept on staring.

 

“My name’s Superboy or Kon-El.” He said bluntly, crossing his arms over his chest. If he was trying to intimidate Danny it wasn’t working. Danny was hard to intimidate after all he’s fought. 

 

No one talked for a few seconds so Danny decided to break the silence. “Are you two brothers? I didn’t know Supes had any siblings.” With the deafening silence that followed his question, it was easy to tell he made a mistake somewhere. 

 

Once again it was Wonder Woman to the rescue, “Superboy is Superman’s clone.” She explained. Danny didn’t really think this explained the tension in the room like she probably thought it did. “Okay..? That’s cool!” He got a few odd looks at that and Superman seemed to come to his own conclusion. “Do you know what a clone is?” It was now Danny who had the weird look on his face. “Of course I do. I have a clone of my own. Her name is Ellie, she’s great, I love her.” 

 

And more silence. The silence was starting to get old. 

 

“You have a clone? And you just don’t care?” Asked Superboy in almost disbelief.

 

“Yeah? I mean we had a rocky beginning with her trying to kill me and all but we're cool now she’s like my little sister.” 

 

Superboy turned back towards Superman with a wave of newfound anger. “Why the hell is a kid handling the fact that he has a clone better than you?”

 

“I’m trying! I’m sorry for how I acted when we first found you but I’m trying now I just wish you could meet me halfway.” 

 

“I don’t need to do shit!” 

 

Okay yeah, Danny definitely just walked into a shitstorm of family drama but he couldn’t help but be confused. Superman seems so nice and chill with everything so far. It’s hard to imagine him rejecting someone for being a clone. Danny also can’t help but think back to when he learned the truth about Ellie. How scared she looked like he would toss her aside as Vlad did. He wouldn’t dream of hurting her like that. To find out Superman, someone who submitted a form to become his guardian, did that to someone. Well, it definitely makes Danny want to burn the form. 

 

“Did you reject him?” He couldn’t help but ask in a small voice, all the attention in the room being directed at him. “What?” 

 

“Did. You. Reject him?” His voice was harder now and the heroes could faintly see his blue eyes returning to the green of his ‘original’ form. The temperature in the room was steadily dropping as Danny’s anger rose. 

 

“Danny, kiddo, you don’t understand fully.” 

 

“I think I understand enough.”

 

“They stole my DNA and I’ll admit I didn’t handle it well at first but I’m trying.” 

 

“Trying doesn’t fix any trauma Kon-El could have.” 

 

Superboy was stunned, to say the least. He hasn’t had people other than his teammates and friends stand up for him like this. This random kid he’s never met before who apparently also has a clone came out of nowhere. It felt… nice to be defended so quickly by a virtual stranger. 

 

“How did your clone come to be?” Batman chimed in asking Danny. 

 

Danny’s attention was brought away from Superman as he thought about how he should answer. “An old enemy wanted me for himself or wanted me gone.” 

 

“The temperature of the room declined. Did you do that?” 

 

Danny shrugged half-heartedly. “It happens sometimes.” 

 

Batman kept pushing on, “When you demonstrated your powers there were some things you didn’t show. Why?” 

 

Danny was back on the floor now. He felt like a child being reprimanded. “I forget about what I can do sometimes.”

 

“How can you forget about a power? About multiple powers?” Batman was walking towards Danny and he took a small step back, not wanting to be crowded but unwilling to show how uncomfortable he truly was. 

 

“You try waking up on a different planet where nothing is the same and remember something that used to be a simple daily occurrence. This is like asking you how you forget about breathing. You just do it.” 

 

“What powers did you forget to mention.”

 

“Why am I being interrogated right now?” 

 

Flash stepped forward, “Don’t mind spooky over there that’s just how the detective is.” He tried to laugh off the awkward tension in the air. 

 

If anything this just ruffled Danny’s feathers. His eyebrows scrunched together and his posture became rigged. “I don’t want a detective right now… I want… time and… understanding.” He turned to leave the room. He was done for today. He wanted to finish his constellations and sit on his bed looking at them with his lights off. 

 

As he made his way through the hallway he heard Superboy say, “You should leave him alone Batman. You heard him, he needs space.” 

 

Silently thanking him in his head Danny continued to his room.

 

—

 

Danny was laying on his bed the next morning, giving more thought to the whole of who should be his legal guardian. The choices seemed more simple now. Getting up he went over to where he kept the files and put them on his desk, spreading them out. 

 

He separated them into two piles. A no and maybe pile. Taking the no pile he tossed them in the small trash can in the corner of his room. Picking up the maybe pile he went through all of them again. 

 

He still had to narrow it down but it was really between three people. 

 

It wasn't until almost lunchtime that he went to find Batman, the person in charge of all the guardian paperwork nonsense. He found the man in the screen room. It wasn't hard gaining his attention. 

 

Danny stilled his nerves and with full confidence he said,

 

“I made my decision.” 

 

—

 

A few days later Danny was packing up his room. There wasn’t much but it was enough to need a few boxes. 

 

He folded all his clothes and took down all the stars. He carefully packed away all the gifts he was given to take to his new room in a new home. He was able to keep his bed sheets and blankets due to them also being gifted to him and him already knowing he was going to have the same type of bed in his new room. 

 

The room looked exactly as it did when he first got there. It was kind of sad. He grew fond of this room and really started to think of it as his, not just a spare room. It was his but now it looked strange and boring. 

 

His door was open so when there was a knock on the door frame he knew who it was. 

 

“You ready to get out of here?” He was asked. Danny smiled and nodded at his new guardian as he walked towards him. This was a new chapter in his life and he was going to have to adjust to it but he thinks he will be fine in the end. 

 

With one last look at a bare room and the last box in his hand, Danny hesitates but allows Dick to put his hand on his shoulder leading him away. 

 

Yeah, he thinks this will be fine.
